ciscoBgp4MIB.name: ciscoBgp4MIB

revisions.description: +Added cbgpNotifsEnable and cbgpLocalAs +Modified CbgpNetworkAddress TC +Added cbgpPeer2Table +Added cbgpPeer2CapsTable +Added cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyTable +Added cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyPrefixTable +Added notification cbgpPeer2EstablishedNotification +Added notification cbgpPeer2BackwardTransNotification +Added notification cbgpPeer2FsmStateChange +Added notification cbgpPeer2BackwardTransition +Added notification cbgpPeer2PrefixThresholdExceeded +Added notification cbgpPeer2PrefixThresholdClear

+Added cbgpPeerCapsTable +Added cbgpPeerAddrFamilyTable +Added cbgpPeerAddrFamilyPrefixTable +Added notification event cbgpBackwardTransition +Added notification event cbgpPrefixThresholdExceeded +Added notification event cbgpPrefixThresholdClear
Initial version of the MIB module.

ciscoBgp4MIB.contactinfo: Cisco Systems Customer Service Postal: 170 W Tasman Drive San Jose, CA 95134 USA Tel: +1 800 553-NETS E-mail: cs-iprouting-bgp@cisco.com
ciscoBgp4MIB.description: An extension to the IETF BGP4 MIB module defined in RFC 1657. Following is the terminology associated with Border Gateway Protocol(BGP). UPDATE message UPDATE messages are used to transfer routing information between BGP peers. An UPDATE message is used to advertise a single feasible route to a peer, or to withdraw multiple unfeasible routes from service. Adj-RIBs-In The Adj-RIBs-In store routing information that has been learned from inbound UPDATE messages. Their contents represent routes that are available as an input to the Decision Process. Loc-RIB(BGP table) The Loc-RIB contains the local routing information that the BGP speaker has selected by applying its local policies to the routing information contained in its Adj-RIBs-In. Adj-RIBs-Out The Adj-RIBs-Out store the information that the local BGP speaker has selected for advertisement to its peers. The routing information stored in the Adj-RIBs-Out will be carried in the local BGP speaker's UPDATE messages and advertised to its peers. Path Attributes A variable length sequence of path attributes is present in every UPDATE. Each path attribute is a triple <attribute type, attribute length, attribute value> of variable length. Network Layer Reachability Information(NLRI) A variable length field present in UPDATE messages which contains a list of Network Layer address prefixes. Address Family Identifier(AFI) Primary identifier to indicate the type of the Network Layer Reachability Information(NLRI) being carried. Subsequent Address Family Identifier(SAFI) Secondary identifier to indicate the type of the Network Layer Reachability Information(NLRI) being carried.

CbgpSafi.name: CbgpSafi
CbgpSafi.description: Subsequent Address Family Identifier(SAFI) is used by BGP speaker to indicate the type of the the Network Layer Reachability Information(NLRI) being carried. RFC-2858 has defined the following values for SAFI. 1 - Network Layer Reachability Information used for unicast forwarding 2 - Network Layer Reachability Information used for multicast forwarding 3 - Network Layer Reachability Information used for both unicast and multicast forwarding. SAFI values 128 through 255 are for private use.
CbgpSafi.reference: RFC-2858: Multiprotocol Extensions for BGP-4, RFC-2547: BGP/MPLS VPNs

CbgpNetworkAddress.name: CbgpNetworkAddress
CbgpNetworkAddress.description: Represents the Network Address prefix carried in the BGP UPDATE messages. In the following table, column 'Type' gives the kind of Network Layer address which will be stored in the object of this type based on the values of Address Family Identifier(AFI) and SAFI. AFI SAFI Type ipv4(1) unicast(1) IPv4 address ipv4(1) multicast(2) IPv4 address ipv4(1) vpn(128) VPN-IPv4 address ipv6(2) unicast(1) IPv6 address ipv6(2) multicast(2) IPv6 address ipv6(2) vpn(128) VPN-IPv6 address A VPN-IPv4 address is a 12-byte quantity, beginning with an 8-byte 'Route Distinguisher (RD)' and ending with a 4-byte IPv4 address. A VPN-IPv6 address is a 24-byte quantity, beginning with an 8-byte 'Route Distinguisher (RD)' and ending with a 16-byte IPv6 address.
CbgpNetworkAddress.reference: RFC 2858, Multiprotocol Extensions for BGP-4. RFC 2547, Section 4.1, BGP/MPLS VPNs.

cbgpNotifsEnable.name: cbgpNotifsEnable
cbgpNotifsEnable.description: Indicates whether the specific notifications are enabled. If notifsEnable(0) bit is set to 1, then the notifications defined in ciscoBgp4NotificationsGroup1 are enabled; If notifsPeer2Enable(1) bit is set to 1, then the notifications defined in ciscoBgp4Peer2NotificationsGroup are enabled.

cbgpLocalAs.name: cbgpLocalAs
cbgpLocalAs.reference: RFC 4271, Section 4.2, 'My Autonomous System'. RFC 4893, BGP Support for Four-octet AS Number Space.

cbgpRouteTable.name: cbgpRouteTable
cbgpRouteTable.reference: RFC-1771: A Border Gateway Protocol 4 (BGP-4), RFC-2858: Multiprotocol Extensions for BGP-4, RFC-2547: BGP/MPLS VPNs
cbgpRouteTable.description: This table contains information about routes to destination networks from all BGP4 peers. Since BGP4 can carry routes for multiple Network Layer protocols, this table has the Address Family Identifier(AFI) of the Network Layer protocol as the first index. Further for a given AFI, routes carried by BGP4 are distinguished based on Subsequent Address Family Identifiers(SAFI). Hence that is used as the second index. Conceptually there is a separate Loc-RIB maintained by the BGP speaker for each combination of AFI and SAFI supported by it.

cbgpRouteEntry.name: cbgpRouteEntry
cbgpRouteEntry.description: Information about a path to a network received from a peer.

cbgpRouteAfi.name: cbgpRouteAfi
cbgpRouteAfi.description: Represents Address Family Identifier(AFI) of the Network Layer protocol associated with the route. An implementation is only required to support IPv4 unicast and VPNv4 (Value - 1) address families.

cbgpRouteSafi.name: cbgpRouteSafi
cbgpRouteSafi.description: Represents Subsequent Address Family Identifier(SAFI) of the route. It gives additional information about the type of the route. An implementation is only required to support IPv4 unicast(Value - 1) and VPNv4( Value - 128) address families.

cbgpRoutePeerType.name: cbgpRoutePeerType
cbgpRoutePeerType.description: Represents the type of Network Layer address stored in cbgpRoutePeer. An implementation is only required to support IPv4 address type(Value - 1).

cbgpRoutePeer.name: cbgpRoutePeer
cbgpRoutePeer.description: The Network Layer address of the peer where the route information was learned. An implementation is only required to support an IPv4 peer.

cbgpRouteAddrPrefix.name: cbgpRouteAddrPrefix
cbgpRouteAddrPrefix.description: A Network Address prefix in the Network Layer Reachability Information field of BGP UPDATE message. This object is a Network Address containing the prefix with length specified by cbgpRouteAddrPrefixLen. Any bits beyond the length specified by cbgpRouteAddrPrefixLen are zeroed.

cbgpRouteAddrPrefixLen.name: cbgpRouteAddrPrefixLen
cbgpRouteAddrPrefixLen.description: Length in bits of the Network Address prefix in the Network Layer Reachability Information field.

cbgpRouteOrigin.name: cbgpRouteOrigin
cbgpRouteOrigin.description: The ultimate origin of the route information.

cbgpRouteASPathSegment.name: cbgpRouteASPathSegment
cbgpRouteASPathSegment.description: The sequence of AS path segments. Each AS path segment is represented by a triple <type, length, value>. The type is a 1-octet field which has two possible values: 1 AS_SET: unordered set of ASs a route in the UPDATE message has traversed 2 AS_SEQUENCE: ordered set of ASs a route in the UPDATE message has traversed. The length is a 1-octet field containing the number of ASs in the value field. The value field contains one or more AS numbers, each AS is represented in the octet string as a pair of octets according to the following algorithm: first-byte-of-pair = ASNumber / 256; second-byte-of-pair = ASNumber & 255;

cbgpRouteNextHop.name: cbgpRouteNextHop
cbgpRouteNextHop.description: The Network Layer address of the border router that should be used for the destination network.

cbgpRouteMedPresent.name: cbgpRouteMedPresent
cbgpRouteMedPresent.description: Indicates the presence/absence of MULTI_EXIT_DISC attribute for the route.

cbgpRouteMultiExitDisc.name: cbgpRouteMultiExitDisc
cbgpRouteMultiExitDisc.description: This metric is used to discriminate between multiple exit points to an adjacent autonomous system. The value of this object is irrelevant if the value of of cbgpRouteMedPresent is false(2).

cbgpRouteLocalPrefPresent.name: cbgpRouteLocalPrefPresent
cbgpRouteLocalPrefPresent.description: Indicates the presence/absence of LOCAL_PREF attribute for the route.

cbgpRouteLocalPref.name: cbgpRouteLocalPref
cbgpRouteLocalPref.description: The degree of preference calculated by the local BGP4 speaker for the route. The value of this object is irrelevant if the value of cbgpRouteLocalPrefPresent is false(2).

cbgpRouteAtomicAggregate.name: cbgpRouteAtomicAggregate
cbgpRouteAtomicAggregate.description: Whether or not the local system has selected a less specific route without selecting a more specific route.

cbgpRouteAggregatorAS.name: cbgpRouteAggregatorAS
cbgpRouteAggregatorAS.description: The AS number of the last BGP4 speaker that performed route aggregation. A value of zero (0) indicates the absence of this attribute.

cbgpRouteAggregatorAddrType.name: cbgpRouteAggregatorAddrType
cbgpRouteAggregatorAddrType.description: Represents the type of Network Layer address stored in cbgpRouteAggregatorAddr.

cbgpRouteAggregatorAddr.name: cbgpRouteAggregatorAddr
cbgpRouteAggregatorAddr.description: The Network Layer address of the last BGP4 speaker that performed route aggregation. A value of all zeros indicates the absence of this attribute.

cbgpRouteBest.name: cbgpRouteBest
cbgpRouteBest.description: An indication of whether or not this route was chosen as the best BGP4 route.

cbgpRouteUnknownAttr.name: cbgpRouteUnknownAttr
cbgpRouteUnknownAttr.reference: RFC-1771: A Border Gateway Protocol 4 (BGP-4), section 4.3
cbgpRouteUnknownAttr.description: One or more path attributes not understood by this BGP4 speaker. Size zero (0) indicates the absence of such attribute(s). Octets beyond the maximum size, if any, are not recorded by this object. Each path attribute is a triple <attribute type, attribute length, attribute value> of variable length. Attribute Type is a two-octet field that consists of the Attribute Flags octet followed by the Attribute Type Code octet. If the Extended Length bit of the Attribute Flags octet is set to 0, the third octet of the Path Attribute contains the length of the attribute data in octets. If the Extended Length bit of the Attribute Flags octet is set to 1, then the third and the fourth octets of the path attribute contain the length of the attribute data in octets. The remaining octets of the Path Attribute represent the attribute value and are interpreted according to the Attribute Flags and the Attribute Type Code.

cbgpPeerTable.name: cbgpPeerTable
cbgpPeerTable.description: BGP peer table. This table contains, one entry per BGP peer, information about the connections with BGP peers.

cbgpPeerEntry.name: cbgpPeerEntry
cbgpPeerEntry.description: Entry containing information about the connection with a BGP peer.

cbgpPeerPrefixAccepted.name: cbgpPeerPrefixAccepted
cbgpPeerPrefixAccepted.description: Number of Route prefixes received on this connnection, which are accepted after applying filters. Possible filters are route maps, prefix lists, distributed lists, etc.

cbgpPeerPrefixDenied.name: cbgpPeerPrefixDenied
cbgpPeerPrefixDenied.description: Counter which gets incremented when a route prefix received on this connection is denied or when a route prefix is denied during soft reset of this connection if 'soft-reconfiguration' is on . This object is initialized to zero when the peer is configured or the router is rebooted

cbgpPeerPrefixLimit.name: cbgpPeerPrefixLimit
cbgpPeerPrefixLimit.description: Max number of route prefixes accepted on this connection

cbgpPeerPrefixAdvertised.name: cbgpPeerPrefixAdvertised
cbgpPeerPrefixAdvertised.description: Counter which gets incremented when a route prefix is advertised on this connection. This object is initialized to zero when the peer is configured or the router is rebooted

cbgpPeerPrefixSuppressed.name: cbgpPeerPrefixSuppressed
cbgpPeerPrefixSuppressed.description: Counter which gets incremented when a route prefix is suppressed from being sent on this connection. This object is initialized to zero when the peer is configured or the router is rebooted

cbgpPeerPrefixWithdrawn.name: cbgpPeerPrefixWithdrawn
cbgpPeerPrefixWithdrawn.description: Counter which gets incremented when a route prefix is withdrawn on this connection. This object is initialized to zero when the peer is configured or the router is rebooted

cbgpPeerLastErrorTxt.name: cbgpPeerLastErrorTxt
cbgpPeerLastErrorTxt.description: Implementation specific error description for bgpPeerLastErrorReceived.

cbgpPeerPrevState.name: cbgpPeerPrevState
cbgpPeerPrevState.reference: Section 8, RFC 1771, A Border Gateway Protocol 4 (BGP-4).
cbgpPeerPrevState.description: The BGP peer connection previous state.

cbgpPeerCapsTable.name: cbgpPeerCapsTable
cbgpPeerCapsTable.reference: RFC 2842, Capabilities Advertisement with BGP-4. RFC2818, Route Refresh Capability for BGP-4. RFC2858, Multiprotocol Extensions for BGP-4. draft-ietf-idr-restart-05.txt, Graceful Restart Mechanism for BGP
cbgpPeerCapsTable.description: This table contains the capabilities that are supported by a peer. Capabilities of a peer are received during BGP connection establishment. Values corresponding to each received capability are stored in this table. When a new capability is received, this table is updated with a new entry. When an existing capability is not received during the latest connection establishment, the corresponding entry is deleted from the table.

cbgpPeerCapsEntry.name: cbgpPeerCapsEntry
cbgpPeerCapsEntry.description: Each entry represents a capability received from a peer with a particular code and an index. When a capability is received multiple times with different values during a BGP connection establishment, corresponding entries are differentiated with indices.

cbgpPeerCapCode.name: cbgpPeerCapCode
cbgpPeerCapCode.reference: RFC 2842, Capabilities Advertisement with BGP-4. RFC2818, Route Refresh Capability for BGP-4. RFC2858, Multiprotocol Extensions for BGP-4. draft-ietf-idr-restart-05.txt, Graceful Restart Mechanism for BGP
cbgpPeerCapCode.description: The BGP Capability Advertisement Capability Code.

cbgpPeerCapIndex.name: cbgpPeerCapIndex
cbgpPeerCapIndex.description: Multiple instances of a given capability may be sent by a BGP speaker. This variable is used to index them.

cbgpPeerCapValue.name: cbgpPeerCapValue
cbgpPeerCapValue.reference: RFC 2842, Capabilities Advertisement with BGP-4. RFC2818, Route Refresh Capability for BGP-4. RFC2858, Multiprotocol Extensions for BGP-4. draft-ietf-idr-restart-05.txt, Graceful Restart Mechanism for BGP

cbgpPeerAddrFamilyTable.name: cbgpPeerAddrFamilyTable
cbgpPeerAddrFamilyTable.description: This table contains information related to address families supported by a peer. Supported address families of a peer are known during BGP connection establishment. When a new supported address family is known, this table is updated with a new entry. When an address family is not supported any more, corresponding entry is deleted from the table.

cbgpPeerAddrFamilyEntry.name: cbgpPeerAddrFamilyEntry
cbgpPeerAddrFamilyEntry.description: An entry is identified by an AFI/SAFI pair and peer address. It contains names associated with an address family.

cbgpPeerAddrFamilyAfi.name: cbgpPeerAddrFamilyAfi
cbgpPeerAddrFamilyAfi.description: The AFI index of the entry. An implementation is only required to support IPv4 unicast and VPNv4 (Value - 1) address families.

cbgpPeerAddrFamilySafi.name: cbgpPeerAddrFamilySafi
cbgpPeerAddrFamilySafi.reference: RFC-2858: Multiprotocol Extensions for BGP-4, RFC-2547: BGP/MPLS VPNs
cbgpPeerAddrFamilySafi.description: The SAFI index of the entry. An implementation is only required to support IPv4 unicast(Value - 1) and VPNv4( Value - 128) address families.

cbgpPeerAddrFamilyPrefixTable.name: cbgpPeerAddrFamilyPrefixTable
cbgpPeerAddrFamilyPrefixTable.description: This table contains prefix related information related to address families supported by a peer. Supported address families of a peer are known during BGP connection establishment. When a new supported address family is known, this table is updated with a new entry. When an address family is not supported any more, corresponding entry is deleted from the table.

cbgpPeerAddrFamilyPrefixEntry.name: cbgpPeerAddrFamilyPrefixEntry
cbgpPeerAddrFamilyPrefixEntry.description: An entry is identified by an AFI/SAFI pair and peer address. It contains information associated with route prefixes belonging to an address family.

cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixes.name: cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixes
cbgpPeerAcceptedPrefixes.description: Number of accepted route prefixes on this connection, which belong to an address family.

cbgpPeerDeniedPrefixes.name: cbgpPeerDeniedPrefixes
cbgpPeerDeniedPrefixes.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, received on this connection is denied. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

cbgpPeerPrefixAdminLimit.name: cbgpPeerPrefixAdminLimit
cbgpPeerPrefixAdminLimit.description: Max number of route prefixes accepted for an address family on this connection.

cbgpPeerPrefixThreshold.name: cbgpPeerPrefixThreshold
cbgpPeerPrefixThreshold.description: Prefix threshold value (%) for an address family on this connection at which warning message stating the prefix count is crossed the threshold or corresponding SNMP notification is generated.

cbgpPeerPrefixClearThreshold.name: cbgpPeerPrefixClearThreshold
cbgpPeerPrefixClearThreshold.description: Prefix threshold value (%) for an address family on this connection at which SNMP clear notification is generated if prefix threshold notification is already generated.

cbgpPeerAdvertisedPrefixes.name: cbgpPeerAdvertisedPrefixes
cbgpPeerAdvertisedPrefixes.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is advertised on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

cbgpPeerSuppressedPrefixes.name: cbgpPeerSuppressedPrefixes
cbgpPeerSuppressedPrefixes.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is suppressed from being sent on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

cbgpPeerWithdrawnPrefixes.name: cbgpPeerWithdrawnPrefixes
cbgpPeerWithdrawnPrefixes.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, is withdrawn on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

cbgpPeer2Table.name: cbgpPeer2Table
cbgpPeer2Table.description: BGP peer table. This table contains, one entry per BGP peer, information about the connections with BGP peers.

cbgpPeer2Entry.name: cbgpPeer2Entry
cbgpPeer2Entry.description: Entry containing information about the connection with a BGP peer.

cbgpPeer2Type.name: cbgpPeer2Type
cbgpPeer2Type.description: Represents the type of Peer address stored in cbgpPeer2Entry.

cbgpPeer2RemoteAddr.name: cbgpPeer2RemoteAddr
cbgpPeer2RemoteAddr.description: The remote IP address of this entry's BGP peer.

cbgpPeer2AdminStatus.name: cbgpPeer2AdminStatus
cbgpPeer2AdminStatus.description: The desired state of the BGP connection. A transition from 'stop' to 'start' will cause the BGP Manual Start Event to be generated. A transition from 'start' to 'stop' will cause the BGP Manual Stop Event to be generated. This parameter can be used to restart BGP peer connections. Care should be used in providing write access to this object without adequate authentication.

cbgpPeer2NegotiatedVersion.name: cbgpPeer2NegotiatedVersion
cbgpPeer2NegotiatedVersion.description: The negotiated version of BGP running between the two peers. This entry MUST be zero (0) unless the cbgpPeer2State is in the openconfirm or the established state. Note that legal values for this object are between 0 and 255.

cbgpPeer2LocalAddr.name: cbgpPeer2LocalAddr
cbgpPeer2LocalAddr.description: The local IP address of this entry's BGP connection.

cbgpPeer2LocalPort.name: cbgpPeer2LocalPort
cbgpPeer2LocalPort.description: The local port for the TCP connection between the BGP peers.

cbgpPeer2LocalAs.name: cbgpPeer2LocalAs
cbgpPeer2LocalAs.description: The local AS number for this session.

cbgpPeer2LocalIdentifier.name: cbgpPeer2LocalIdentifier
cbgpPeer2LocalIdentifier.description: The BGP Identifier of this entry's BGP peer.

cbgpPeer2RemotePort.name: cbgpPeer2RemotePort
cbgpPeer2RemotePort.description: The remote port for the TCP connection between the BGP peers. Note that the objects cbgpPeer2LocalAddr, cbgpPeer2LocalPort, cbgpPeer2RemoteAddr, and cbgpPeer2RemotePort provide the appropriate reference to the standard MIB TCP connection table.

cbgpPeer2RemoteAs.name: cbgpPeer2RemoteAs
cbgpPeer2RemoteAs.description: The remote autonomous system number received in the BGP OPEN message.

cbgpPeer2RemoteIdentifier.name: cbgpPeer2RemoteIdentifier
cbgpPeer2RemoteIdentifier.description: The BGP Identifier of this entry's BGP peer. This entry MUST be 0.0.0.0 unless the cbgpPeer2State is in the openconfirm or the established state.

cbgpPeer2InUpdates.name: cbgpPeer2InUpdates
cbgpPeer2InUpdates.description: The number of BGP UPDATE messages received on this connection.

cbgpPeer2OutUpdates.name: cbgpPeer2OutUpdates
cbgpPeer2OutUpdates.description: The number of BGP UPDATE messages transmitted on this connection.

cbgpPeer2InTotalMessages.name: cbgpPeer2InTotalMessages
cbgpPeer2InTotalMessages.description: The total number of messages received from the remote peer on this connection.

cbgpPeer2OutTotalMessages.name: cbgpPeer2OutTotalMessages
cbgpPeer2OutTotalMessages.description: The total number of messages transmitted to the remote peer on this connection.

cbgpPeer2LastError.name: cbgpPeer2LastError
cbgpPeer2LastError.description: The last error code and subcode seen by this peer on this connection. If no error has occurred, this field is zero. Otherwise, the first byte of this two byte OCTET STRING contains the error code, and the second byte contains the subcode.

cbgpPeer2FsmEstablishedTransitions.name: cbgpPeer2FsmEstablishedTransitions
cbgpPeer2FsmEstablishedTransitions.description: The total number of times the BGP FSM transitioned into the established state for this peer.

cbgpPeer2FsmEstablishedTime.name: cbgpPeer2FsmEstablishedTime
cbgpPeer2FsmEstablishedTime.description: This timer indicates how long (in seconds) this peer has been in the established state or how long since this peer was last in the established state. It is set to zero when a new peer is configured or when the router is booted.

cbgpPeer2ConnectRetryInterval.name: cbgpPeer2ConnectRetryInterval
cbgpPeer2ConnectRetryInterval.reference: RFC 4271, Section 8.2.2. This is the value used to initialize the 'ConnectRetryTimer'.
cbgpPeer2ConnectRetryInterval.description: Time interval (in seconds) for the ConnectRetry timer. The suggested value for this timer is 120 seconds.

cbgpPeer2HoldTime.name: cbgpPeer2HoldTime
cbgpPeer2HoldTime.description: Time interval (in seconds) for the Hold Timer established with the peer. The value of this object is calculated by this BGP speaker, using the smaller of the values in cbgpPeer2HoldTimeConfigured and the Hold Time received in the OPEN message. This value must be at least three seconds if it is not zero (0). If the Hold Timer has not been established with the peer this object MUST have a value of zero (0). If the cbgpPeer2HoldTimeConfigured object has a value of (0), then this object MUST have a value of (0).

cbgpPeer2KeepAlive.name: cbgpPeer2KeepAlive
cbgpPeer2KeepAlive.description: Time interval (in seconds) for the KeepAlive timer established with the peer. The value of this object is calculated by this BGP speaker such that, when compared with cbgpPeer2HoldTime, it has the same proportion that cbgpPeer2KeepAliveConfigured has, compared with cbgpPeer2HoldTimeConfigured. If the KeepAlive timer has not been established with the peer, this object MUST have a value of zero (0). If the of cbgpPeer2KeepAliveConfigured object has a value of (0), then this object MUST have a value of (0).

cbgpPeer2HoldTimeConfigured.name: cbgpPeer2HoldTimeConfigured
cbgpPeer2HoldTimeConfigured.description: Time interval (in seconds) for the Hold Time configured for this BGP speaker with this peer. This value is placed in an OPEN message sent to this peer by this BGP speaker, and is compared with the Hold Time field in an OPEN message received from the peer when determining the Hold Time (cbgpPeer2HoldTime) with the peer. This value must not be less than three seconds if it is not zero (0). If it is zero (0), the Hold Time is NOT to be established with the peer. The suggested value for this timer is 90 seconds.

cbgpPeer2KeepAliveConfigured.name: cbgpPeer2KeepAliveConfigured
cbgpPeer2KeepAliveConfigured.description: Time interval (in seconds) for the KeepAlive timer configured for this BGP speaker with this peer. The value of this object will only determine the KEEPALIVE messages' frequency relative to the value specified in cbgpPeer2HoldTimeConfigured; the actual time interval for the KEEPALIVE messages is indicated by cbgpPeer2KeepAlive. A reasonable maximum value for this timer would be one third of that of cbgpPeer2HoldTimeConfigured. If the value of this object is zero (0), no periodical KEEPALIVE messages are sent to the peer after the BGP connection has been established. The suggested value for this timer is 30 seconds.

cbgpPeer2MinASOriginationInterval.name: cbgpPeer2MinASOriginationInterval
cbgpPeer2MinASOriginationInterval.description: Time interval (in seconds) for the MinASOriginationInterval timer. The suggested value for this timer is 15 seconds.

cbgpPeer2MinRouteAdvertisementInterval.name: cbgpPeer2MinRouteAdvertisementInterval
cbgpPeer2MinRouteAdvertisementInterval.description: Time interval (in seconds) for the MinRouteAdvertisementInterval timer. The suggested value for this timer is 30 seconds for EBGP connections and 5 seconds for IBGP connections.

cbgpPeer2InUpdateElapsedTime.name: cbgpPeer2InUpdateElapsedTime
cbgpPeer2InUpdateElapsedTime.reference: RFC 4271, Section 4.3. RFC 4271, Section 8.2.2, Established state.
cbgpPeer2InUpdateElapsedTime.description: Elapsed time (in seconds) since the last BGP UPDATE message was received from the peer. Each time cbgpPeer2InUpdates is incremented, the value of this object is set to zero (0).

cbgpPeer2LastErrorTxt.name: cbgpPeer2LastErrorTxt
cbgpPeer2LastErrorTxt.description: Implementation specific error description for bgpPeerLastErrorReceived.

cbgpPeer2PrevState.name: cbgpPeer2PrevState
cbgpPeer2PrevState.reference: RFC 1771, Section 8, A Border Gateway Protocol 4 (BGP-4).
cbgpPeer2PrevState.description: The BGP peer connection previous state.

cbgpPeer2CapsTable.name: cbgpPeer2CapsTable
cbgpPeer2CapsTable.reference: RFC 2842, Capabilities Advertisement with BGP-4. RFC 2818, Route Refresh Capability for BGP-4. RFC 2858, Multiprotocol Extensions for BGP-4. RFC 4724, Graceful Restart Mechanism for BGP. RFC 4893, BGP Support for Four-octet AS Number Space. draft-ietf-idr-add-paths-04.txt, Advertisement of Multiple Paths in BGP.
cbgpPeer2CapsTable.description: This table contains the capabilities that are supported by a peer. Capabilities of a peer are received during BGP connection establishment. Values corresponding to each received capability are stored in this table. When a new capability is received, this table is updated with a new entry. When an existing capability is not received during the latest connection establishment, the corresponding entry is deleted from the table.

cbgpPeer2CapsEntry.name: cbgpPeer2CapsEntry
cbgpPeer2CapsEntry.description: Each entry represents a capability received from a peer with a particular code and an index. When a capability is received multiple times with different values during a BGP connection establishment, corresponding entries are differentiated with indices.

cbgpPeer2CapCode.name: cbgpPeer2CapCode
cbgpPeer2CapCode.reference: RFC 2842, Capabilities Advertisement with BGP-4. RFC 2818, Route Refresh Capability for BGP-4. RFC 2858, Multiprotocol Extensions for BGP-4. RFC 4724, Graceful Restart Mechanism for BGP. RFC 4893, BGP Support for Four-octet AS Number Space. draft-ietf-idr-add-paths-04.txt, Advertisement of Multiple Paths in BGP.
cbgpPeer2CapCode.description: The BGP Capability Advertisement Capability Code.

cbgpPeer2CapIndex.name: cbgpPeer2CapIndex
cbgpPeer2CapIndex.description: Multiple instances of a given capability may be sent by a BGP speaker. This variable is used to index them.

cbgpPeer2CapValue.name: cbgpPeer2CapValue
cbgpPeer2CapValue.reference: RFC 2842, Capabilities Advertisement with BGP-4. RFC 2818, Route Refresh Capability for BGP-4. RFC 2858, Multiprotocol Extensions for BGP-4. RFC 4724, Graceful Restart Mechanism for BGP. RFC 4893, BGP Support for Four-octet AS Number Space. draft-ietf-idr-add-paths-04.txt, Advertisement of Multiple Paths in BGP.

cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyTable.name: cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyTable
cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyTable.description: This table contains information related to address families supported by a peer. Supported address families of a peer are known during BGP connection establishment. When a new supported address family is known, this table is updated with a new entry. When an address family is not supported any more, corresponding entry is deleted from the table.

cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyEntry.name: cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyEntry
cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyEntry.description: An entry is identified by an AFI/SAFI pair and peer address. It contains names associated with an address family.

cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyAfi.name: cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyAfi
cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyAfi.description: The AFI index of the entry. An implementation is only required to support IPv4 unicast and VPNv4 (Value - 1) address families.

cbgpPeer2AddrFamilySafi.name: cbgpPeer2AddrFamilySafi
cbgpPeer2AddrFamilySafi.reference: RFC 2858, Multiprotocol Extensions for BGP-4. RFC 2547, BGP/MPLS VPNs.
cbgpPeer2AddrFamilySafi.description: The SAFI index of the entry. An implementation is only required to support IPv4 unicast(Value - 1) and VPNv4( Value - 128) address families.

cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyPrefixTable.name: cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyPrefixTable
cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyPrefixTable.description: This table contains prefix related information related to address families supported by a peer. Supported address families of a peer are known during BGP connection establishment. When a new supported address family is known, this table is updated with a new entry. When an address family is not supported any more, corresponding entry is deleted from the table.

cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyPrefixEntry.name: cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyPrefixEntry
cbgpPeer2AddrFamilyPrefixEntry.description: An entry is identified by an AFI/SAFI pair and peer address. It contains information associated with route prefixes belonging to an address family.

cbgpPeer2AcceptedPrefixes.name: cbgpPeer2AcceptedPrefixes
cbgpPeer2AcceptedPrefixes.description: Number of accepted route prefixes on this connection, which belong to an address family.

cbgpPeer2DeniedPrefixes.name: cbgpPeer2DeniedPrefixes
cbgpPeer2DeniedPrefixes.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, received on this connection is denied. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

cbgpPeer2PrefixAdminLimit.name: cbgpPeer2PrefixAdminLimit
cbgpPeer2PrefixAdminLimit.description: Max number of route prefixes accepted for an address family on this connection.

cbgpPeer2PrefixThreshold.name: cbgpPeer2PrefixThreshold
cbgpPeer2PrefixThreshold.description: Prefix threshold value (%) for an address family on this connection at which warning message stating the prefix count is crossed the threshold or corresponding SNMP notification is generated.

cbgpPeer2PrefixClearThreshold.name: cbgpPeer2PrefixClearThreshold
cbgpPeer2PrefixClearThreshold.description: Prefix threshold value (%) for an address family on this connection at which SNMP clear notification is generated if prefix threshold notification is already generated.

cbgpPeer2AdvertisedPrefixes.name: cbgpPeer2AdvertisedPrefixes
cbgpPeer2AdvertisedPrefixes.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is advertised on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

cbgpPeer2SuppressedPrefixes.name: cbgpPeer2SuppressedPrefixes
cbgpPeer2SuppressedPrefixes.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family is suppressed from being sent on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

cbgpPeer2WithdrawnPrefixes.name: cbgpPeer2WithdrawnPrefixes
cbgpPeer2WithdrawnPrefixes.description: This counter is incremented when a route prefix, which belongs to an address family, is withdrawn on this connection. It is initialized to zero when the connection is undergone a hard reset.

cbgpFsmStateChange.name: cbgpFsmStateChange
cbgpFsmStateChange.description: The BGP cbgpFsmStateChange notification is generated for every BGP FSM state change. The bgpPeerRemoteAddr value is attached to the notification object ID.

cbgpBackwardTransition.name: cbgpBackwardTransition
cbgpBackwardTransition.description: The cbgpBackwardTransition Event is generated when the BGP FSM moves from a higher numbered state to a lower numbered state. The bgpPeerRemoteAddr value is attached to the notification object ID.

cbgpPrefixThresholdExceeded.name: cbgpPrefixThresholdExceeded
cbgpPrefixThresholdExceeded.description: The cbgpPrefixThresholdExceeded notification is generated when prefix count exceeds the configured warning threshold on a session for an address family. The bgpPeerRemoteAddr, cbgpPeerAddrFamilyAfi and cbgpPeerAddrFamilySafi values are attached to the notification object ID.

cbgpPrefixThresholdClear.name: cbgpPrefixThresholdClear
cbgpPrefixThresholdClear.description: The cbgpPrefixThresholdClear notification is generated when prefix count drops below the configured clear threshold on a session for an address family once cbgpPrefixThresholdExceeded is generated. This won't be generated if the peer session goes down after the generation of cbgpPrefixThresholdExceeded. The bgpPeerRemoteAddr, cbgpPeerAddrFamilyAfi and cbgpPeerAddrFamilySafi values are attached to the notification object ID.

cbgpPeer2EstablishedNotification.name: cbgpPeer2EstablishedNotification
cbgpPeer2EstablishedNotification.description: The cbgpPeer2EstablishedNotification notification is generated when the BGP FSM enters the established state.

cbgpPeer2BackwardTransNotification.name: cbgpPeer2BackwardTransNotification
cbgpPeer2BackwardTransNotification.description: The cbgpPeer2BackwardTransNotification notification is generated when the BGP FSM moves from a higher numbered state to a lower numbered state.

cbgpPeer2FsmStateChange.name: cbgpPeer2FsmStateChange
cbgpPeer2FsmStateChange.description: The cbgpPeer2FsmStateChange notification is generated for every BGP FSM state change.

cbgpPeer2BackwardTransition.name: cbgpPeer2BackwardTransition
cbgpPeer2BackwardTransition.description: The cbgpPeer2BackwardTransition notification is generated when the BGP FSM moves from a higher numbered state to a lower numbered state.

cbgpPeer2PrefixThresholdExceeded.name: cbgpPeer2PrefixThresholdExceeded
cbgpPeer2PrefixThresholdExceeded.description: The cbgpPeer2PrefixThresholdExceeded notification is generated when prefix count exceeds the configured warning threshold on a session for an address family.

cbgpPeer2PrefixThresholdClear.name: cbgpPeer2PrefixThresholdClear
cbgpPeer2PrefixThresholdClear.description: The cbgpPeer2PrefixThresholdClear notification is generated when prefix count drops below the configured clear threshold on a session for an address family once cbgpPeer2PrefixThresholdExceeded is generated. This will not be generated if the peer session goes down after the generation of cbgpPrefixThresholdExceeded.

ciscoBgp4MIBCompliance.name: ciscoBgp4MIBCompliance
ciscoBgp4MIBCompliance.description: The compliance statement for entities which implement the Cisco BGP4 MIB

ciscoBgp4MIBComplianceRev1.name: ciscoBgp4MIBComplianceRev1
ciscoBgp4MIBComplianceRev1.description: The compliance statement for entities which implement the Cisco BGP4 MIB

ciscoBgp4MIBComplianceRev2.name: ciscoBgp4MIBComplianceRev2
ciscoBgp4MIBComplianceRev2.description: The compliance statement for entities which implement the Cisco BGP4 MIB

ciscoBgp4MIBComplianceRev3.name: ciscoBgp4MIBComplianceRev3
ciscoBgp4MIBComplianceRev3.description: The compliance statement for entities which implement the Cisco BGP4 MIB

ciscoBgp4RouteGroup.name: ciscoBgp4RouteGroup
ciscoBgp4RouteGroup.description: A collection of objects providing information about routes received by BGP speaker.

ciscoBgp4PeerGroup.name: ciscoBgp4PeerGroup
ciscoBgp4PeerGroup.description: A collection of objects providing information about routes received by BGP speaker.

ciscoBgp4NotificationsGroup.name: ciscoBgp4NotificationsGroup
ciscoBgp4NotificationsGroup.description: The collection of notifications related to BGP.

ciscoBgp4PeerGroup1.name: ciscoBgp4PeerGroup1
ciscoBgp4PeerGroup1.description: A collection of objects providing information about a BGP peer.

ciscoBgp4NotificationsGroup1.name: ciscoBgp4NotificationsGroup1
ciscoBgp4NotificationsGroup1.description: The collection of notifications related to BGP.

ciscoBgp4Peer2Group.name: ciscoBgp4Peer2Group
ciscoBgp4Peer2Group.description: A collection of objects providing information about a BGP peer.

ciscoBgp4Peer2NotificationsGroup.name: ciscoBgp4Peer2NotificationsGroup
ciscoBgp4Peer2NotificationsGroup.description: A collection of notifications related to BGP.

ciscoBgp4GlobalGroup.name: ciscoBgp4GlobalGroup
ciscoBgp4GlobalGroup.description: A collection of global objects related to BGP.
